website_summaries.verdict: Provides good internet speeds, but some have issues with a particular piece of hardware in the modem.
pros: Works with Comcast Xfinity, Spectrum, Cox, Mediacom, and more
Capable of up speeds up to 1.4 Gbps for downloads and 262 Mbps for uploads
cons: This modem uses the Intel Puma 6 chipset, which several buyers noted has a history of failing
Does not include Wi-Fi and isn't compatible with voice plans

website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, entry-level cable modem with few faults and high satisfaction ratings.
pros: Incredibly fast download speeds -designed for people that stream videos and multimedia
cons: Upload speed, at 262 Mbps, is not exceptional

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: *****WARNING DO NOT BUY***** It is using a faulty chip that WILL go bad sooner or later. Firmware updates have been rolled out, however it is a HARDWARE issue (hence why none have worked). I doubt many will see this post, which is a shame, but I felt like the least I could do is try and warn others. I can't post a link, but search for: Intel's buggy Puma 6 chipset earns Arris a gigabit-modem lawsuit for more information.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Unusable with VPN and Cox Ultimate
customer_reviews.text: I can confirm that with the 9.1.93N firmware (latest) on Cox Ultimate tier, this modem plays absolute havoc with VPN connections (needed for work). I kept getting drops and a large amount of correctable and uncorrectable packets. Cox cannot downgrade the firmware to a previous version, so your best bet for now is to get a different cable modem. I would often lose several downstream channels entirely. Update Oct 24, 2016: Ended up purchasing the, and it works much better. Very low number of correctable and uncorrectables, and no problem with any VPN connections.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R

customer_reviews.title: Will not honor warranty. Customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: "Warranty" is simply a lie. After only 4 1/2 months, the modem starting failing. Cox Internet convinced me (multiple agents, multiple conversations) that the numbers were good on their end. I spent an hour with an Arris agent looking at the raw numbers via a website (read off 36 sets of Power and SNR numbers to them!), and they said the numbers indicated that Cox's service was bad, despite the data easily meeting the criteria recommended by the Arris website itself (sorry Amazon won't let me include URL, but google Cable-Signal-Levels). Do not buy an Arris modem unless you are willing to be treated very badly should you get a lemon. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndiego

customer_reviews.title: This modem currently has spikes in ping and moderate packet loss
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem some time ago, but it has a flaw that results in spikes in ping every 2 seconds and after a few days will result in 2-10% packet loss. This has been known for at least 6 months and has yet to be fixed. I would not recommend this modem until the issue with the Puma6 chipset in this modem gets resolved. This is noticeable during every day browsing and definitely during gaming. There are reports of this on dslreports.com. just google dslreports puma6 for more info.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Excellent Value, Future Proof
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: I had to enable "Energy Efficient Ethernet" to reduce the external temperature of the unit and improve connection quality. Located at "192.168.100.1/cgi-bin/configuration" This may be due to my ISP (Comcast had some buggy version pushed to my modem) I haven't had any issues at all since I have installed the modem and let it receive the firmware from Comcast. I don't have internet slowdown or connections dropping. I have 4 people and over 20 devices on a 150 Down/10 up connection. Just check and see if you can ENABLE "EEE" on the modem homepage. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Agent Vokun

customer_reviews.title: Utter flaming pile of garbage for gaming
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this would be a good upgrade from my SB6141, boy was I wrong. In terms of functionality for anything BUT GAMING, it doesn’t give me many issues. However since I use it mostly FOR gaming, therein lies the issue. It drops packets and lags periodically making it virtually impossible to play any kind of competitive FPS/RTS/(well, any type) game that requires quick responses to in-game events. I have been periodically checking for any kind of fix or workaround for the issues others have documented and reported repeatedly, with no success. If you game online, especially any game produced by UBISOFT or on the UPlay platform, don’t even consider this device.
customer_reviews.author: Tirvon

customer_reviews.title: This pays for itself
customer_reviews.text: I save $11 a month by using my own equipment and after 4 months this will have payed for itself. I have the 150mbps plan and was getting 90-100 with old modem. Picked this one up and it works great. Im getting 160-180mbps now! PROS: Pays for its self Easy to connect 32x8 delivers great speed DOCSIS 3.0 CONS: No built in router or wifi Overall: Great buy at $40 from amazon warehouse. Good replacement for any modem that is older than 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: RDB

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK FOR OPTIMUM!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just putting this out there as a warning. I bought this based on the recommendation of site pickmymodem.com. Apparently for Optimum, it doesn't support anything beyond 16x4. I didn't want to give the modem a bad score, so I rated it 5 stars. But after spending 2 hours on the phone to upgrade to faster speeds, the rep tried, but couldn't get it working. After more research, someone on another site mentioned the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Another Weekend Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Constant internet disconnects
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I purchased this modem in Jan., 2018. About 3 months ago, I started getting random losses of my internet connection from Cox. Over the next three months, the disconnects began occurring several times per day. Often, it was difficult to get the modem to re-establish communication with Cox. Re-boot, re-boot, re-boot constantly. Would just fail randomly. I finally hooked up an Arris SB6141 that I had removed previously and held onto for a backup. I have had no issues since. The 6141 has been rock solid. Google "Intel Puma 6 chipset" to see for yourself what the known problems are with this modem. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: LeftSeat

customer_reviews.title: Non-techie Recommendation
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm not a techie. I read the reviews and most of them went way over my head. I have no idea what the speed and all that other technical stuff means. I'm an average Gen X'r with the need for speedy wifi and one that's reliable. I got it in this device. I would recommend it. It was super easy to install and seems to be working great. There are cheaper ones out there but this is the one recommended by my Comcast guy. So far I haven't been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected for more than a day or two at a time
customer_reviews.text: Only upgraded to this modem because Comcast had upgraded out area to 250 download speed. Bought it 4 months ago and now it won't stay connected for more than a day or two at a time. When it does reboot itself, it will typically do so within an hour again. Can't send it back but am researching for an alternative. Very frustrating. Did some searching now and saw the lawsuit year ago against Arris for this exact same modem. That was my fault for not seeing that before I bought it originally.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Crosby

customer_reviews.title: it isn't because I didn't like it. It worked well for connecting to my ...
customer_reviews.text: I want to start by saying I returned this product. However, it isn't because I didn't like it. It worked well for connecting to my cable provider (Charter Spectrum, verified support). However, if you are going to also be getting phone service through your provider be aware that you may have to use the cable company's equipment. This cable modem doesn't have the necessary connections to support both Internet and phone service.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Optimum (Cablevision)
customer_reviews.text: The Arris SURFboard SB6190 does not work with Optimum Online (Cablevision). Before I purchased this model I read a review that stated that this particular model worked with Optimum but when I called Optimum to activate the modem they couldn't get it to connect. I called Arris Customer Support and they pretty much said that this particular model has compatibility issues with Optimum. Arris Customer Support did suggest the SB6141 and SB6183 models as those particular models did have a higher rate of connecting with Optimum. Surprising since the SB6190 model I purchased is exactly the same as the SB6141 and SB6183 just more capable then those previous two models I mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: jctejada77

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, works great, getting great speeds from my ISP
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a previous Arris SB that had a limit of 100Mbps (which was still working great). Don't mind that it's only in white, but some may. Easy set up, no problem with activation through TWC, works great so far. One note: this doesn't have an integrated WiFi router - which I didn't need as I have an Apple Airport, but it only has one ethernet port. So if you need to connect a wireless router AND plug in a hard-line computer simultaneously, make sure your router has an additional port for your hard line.
customer_reviews.author: Mgmt NinjaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Device can be registered to previous owner - amazon does not check!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used from the amazon warehouse. When I called xfinity to set it up, it was still registered to the previous owner! Luckily the old owner was till an xfinity customer in good standing, with another device registered to their account, otherwise I’d have been SOL. As it was, I had to provide xfinity proof of purchase, and they had to remove the serial number of this device from their known devices catalog before it could be registered to me. This took 3 business days (plus it happened on a Friday, so really dragged it out), so just something to keep in mind. Amazon doesn’t check that the device has been unregistered.
customer_reviews.author: slayj

customer_reviews.title: As it says!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this modem. Now understand this is a modem. It delivers a connection to your ISP and a public ip to the the device you plug into it. You get nothing else, so you will want a router of some type to put between it and your home devices. You will also need to call your isp so they can provision your mac (device mac not mac pc). It is that simple and it works perfect. I get 100% of my 200mbps, where as, with my isp equipment I could not get over 80mbps!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Was able to get good speed even though ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Was able to get good speed even though I'm using wifi. BUT the thing emits a blue light that lights up the room. I thought it was just the indicator lights but after covering them I realized the whole box is aerated —presumably to keep it cool. Now I've got to figure out how to box it off in a way to darken it but allow it to stay cool. Buying something like this I wouldn't have thought or expected this to be a problem but it's in our bedroom/office and we don't have a choice so...
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGuy

customer_reviews.title: Long term quality issues
customer_reviews.text: After several years of use, this modem starts giving us problem at the time I have to work from home. Randomly, it disconnects. Normal rest sometimes work but not always. Yesterday modem lost connection again and I could not make it work again by disconnecting power for 15 seconds. it doesn’t work. Instead of doing a normal reset as instructed by Comcast, I did factory full reset. And that fixed the problem for now . The chance is that modem firmware can not deal with the fact it has logs filled up with errors and got into a lock up stage. I am sure it is a software issue that can not deal with some hw condition.
customer_reviews.author: ZN

customer_reviews.title: Poor Engineering / Deceptive Performance - Steer Clear
customer_reviews.text: Noted shortly after receiving this modem that it suffered from unreasonably high ping times and latency spikes. This was later understood to be due at least in part due to the Puma6 chipset issue. Opened a technical support case directly with Arris, and created a thread on DSLReports with additional information. Unfortunately, the issue was never resolved. A $150 (US) paperweight... Steer clear of this one. I recently purchased an SB8200 as a replacement which seems to at least be an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Payne

customer_reviews.title: Purchased but not used
customer_reviews.text: We lost our internet signal and assumed that it was the modem we had. Called tech support but because of lockdown we could not get tech evaluation for two weeks. Took another 2 weeks to have the line to the house installed. By the time we found that our current modem worked well it was too late to return. Having said that, our current modem is identical to this one and it works very well
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Even when everything says it's good.... it still doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This was brand new, out of the box. I put it on the cable and activated it... everything came up good, no internet. 50 min later on the phone with tech support, the modem sends and receives signal from them fine but still no internet. A tech visit later, the tech check the cable from my modem to the TAP out in the yard.... everything was fine, the modem provisioned fine... still no internet. I bought a netgear, plugged it in, ran through the xfinity activation sequence and bam! everything was not only fine but I had internet. My advice, save yourself 4 hours of your life, spend the extra $20 on the netgear, and don't buy this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Karim Sharif

customer_reviews.title: Verify service tier with your provider first
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this device, you should know that there seems to be some discrepancy with the speed capabilities of this device. On the Amazon page, there is a chart that lists this model (SB6190) as having 1.4 Gbps download speed, but the product description higher up on the page shows 644 Mbps. The manufacturer lists this device as 644 Mbps as well. The second note is that using this device with Xfinity / Comcast in Northwest Indiana, I have been informed by Xfinity Customer Service that they limit the service tier to 250 Mbps for this device, so you will not get higher than that, at least not in my service area.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Defective right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: At first, very impressive. It easily reached the 500Mb speeds from my internet provider. However, once connected and running, the cable modem would restart/reset every 7-12 minutes. I called my service provider and they even sent a tech out to see if anything was wrong on their end. Nope. It was 100% the modem. After doing a bit of research, this seems to be a common problem with this modem. I went to a local store, spent a few $$$ more on a replacement, and the issue immediately disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: El Hikkus

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast internet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Motorola all in one cable modem along with Linksys second fastest WiFi router and the combo is ridiculously fast. I read an article that stated the more pathways you have in a modem the more bandwidth you are able to allow through, basically just like water the path of least resistance and more of the of the neighborhoods bandwidth will come to you verses a more restrictive system in effect. . It has been dramatic the difference between our old set up and the new, from less than the 60 mbps we pay for to consistently getting 100mbps over WiFi
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeyefanjustin

customer_reviews.title: Good modem for the casual user.
customer_reviews.text: We have WOW 300/20 and have been using this modem since Thanksgiving. Being the first person allowed on their network with this modem, I have had zero issues with it. We are buying a condo in the next few weeks and I've just ordered a second unit for said condo. If you have WOW service I would highly recommend this solid and stable modem. It has a heat sync and does NOT overheat. Edit: We experienced PUMA6 issues regarding latency. This modem would drop packets and cause all sorts of issues while streaming 4K and gaming. We no longer use it.
customer_reviews.author: CLC

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best cable modem!
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best units out there to take full advantage of higher cable internet speeds. I have never had issues with an Arris or Motorola Surfboard and that continues with this unit. If I had to pick one thing I dont like about this unit however... The lights on the front of the unit are EXTREMELY bright. But I'll take con and and have a quality unit any day.
customer_reviews.author: N S

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS MODEM
customer_reviews.text: This model is known to have issues with lagging and connectivity. There is a class action lawsuit against Arris because of a faulty chip. I have had this modem since November and it has had increasingly more issues connecting. just avoid the headache and don't buy this. I wish I'd known. I'm trying to get a refund from Arris, since I wasn't aware of the issue until my return window with Amazon had closed.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousIsAWoman

customer_reviews.title: Not good.  Bad, like all the rest of the 32x8 Docsis 3.0 cable modems
customer_reviews.text: All the 32x8 Docsis 3.0 cable modems use the same bad chipset. They all will drop connections many times a day. Calling the cable company for service will result in them replacing the cable from the street box to your house. Calling them again will result in them replacing the cable in your house (for a big fee). Calling them again will result in more frustration. Replacing this modem with a NETGEAR Nighthawk Cable Modem CM1200 will result in a solid stable internet that never crashes and more time to write reviews on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TI99

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Used with Xfinity and Netgear Nighthawk router - system upgrade. Pros - Arrived quickly in excellent condition - Easy no problem install and setup - Faster Ethernet connection and somewhat faster WiFi Cons - None so far - only 4 stars because I have only had the system up for a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Markk

customer_reviews.title: Why pay cable company monthly rental
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my monthly modem rental and this was an easy cost saving. I use Xfinity and took my old one to the local store to return and they actually did the configuration in their store. They said it is easier that way and I simply plugged it back in when I went home and everything worked the save as before with an equally good wifi signal. My home is small so the wifi signal doesn't have to work hard to cover ever square foot. Very happy so far with the modem (and monthly savings:)
customer_reviews.author: M491

customer_reviews.title: Arris Surfboard??
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were generally glowing about the Arris Surfboard, but I had read that some users have a hard time connecting it to their service. Well, after multiple calls w/ Cox it was determined that this unit would simply not activate on their service. Went and picked up a unit directly from Cox and it fired up and worked on the first try. Oh well, the unit is being sent back. I guess when they say some users have a hard time getting it to connect to their provide they mean it.
customer_reviews.author: Billfnmurray

customer_reviews.title: Unable to activate the SB6190 modem on Xfinity Comcast Internet service
customer_reviews.text: The Comcast lists the SB6190 as a compatible modem of its Internet service (150 Mb/sec). The model maker claims that the modem is certified to Comcast internet service. But the modem cannot connect to the network (Online LED keeps blinking forever). I put in my old modems, SB6121 and SB6141. They both connect to the network quickly and without any problem. It is just too much frustration for an "upgrade". Possible I am unlucky enough to receive a defective modem with the dreadful Puma chip set.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Does *not* support the gigabit tier on Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: Does *not* support the gigabit tier on Comcast. Plagued with latency issues due to the Puma 6 chipset (class action lawsuit pending). If you want gigabit speeds on Comcast you're limited in your options as Comcast won't activate this device on their gigabit tier. You can rent an XB6 from Comcast or use the Arris SB8200 which Comcast *will* activate on their gigabit tier. Seemed to work fine on the 450 Mbps package, but latency was occasionally an issue. I'd avoid this model if possible.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Avoiding this brand from now on.
customer_reviews.text: This sunovagun worked fine for months then suddenly decided to become possessed. Download speeds would range from 180mbps to 4mbps in a matter of seconds. This caused streams to buffer and connections in online games to be dropped. I troubleshooted for 2 months, had my ISP come out 3 times, screwed around in powershell, did a factory reset, updated firmware, etc... What fixed it? Getting a different modem. Won't be using this brand ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get it to connect with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Might just be my location in SW Florida, but I went through two of these and neither would connect with Comcast. Had a Comcast tech come out and he acknowleged that signal strengths were all good and he couldn't see any reason for the problem. I'm hardly new to this stuff and knew everything here is up to snuff. I've already spent three days on this and not about to waste more time on going back and forth between Comcast and Arris, who, no doubt, will blame each other. Netgear is next on the list, hope I don't waste any more time on this.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R

customer_reviews.title: Good product definitely handles 200Mbps speeds but
customer_reviews.text: Good product definitely handles 200Mbps speeds but, unlike the 6183 that it replaced, this modem has no provision to disable the EXTREMELY BRIGHT AND ANNOYING front panel lights. The additional power consumption probably adds to the EXCESSIVE HEAT generated by this unit relative to the 6183. The 6183 didn't have the provision to disable the lights at first. That got added to the menu at some point later. > 1 year later. I hope ARRIS will push that change for this modem as well. Those lights are unnecessarily bright!!!!
customer_reviews.author: shkhzrd

customer_reviews.title: this is a good modem, with that being said I did have ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a good modem, with that being said I did have issues "stabilizing" it... I had to add a few splitters to bring the cable signal down to get my upstream back to normal but now it is all good and I have the speeds that I pay for, I also have Cox communication and it works good with their system UPDATE after speaking with Arris there is a known firmware issue with the puma chipsets in these that HAS NOT had a fix for, I returned it due to needing my internet now not when they are dragging they feet on the fix...
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: Blindingly fast, forward compatible, and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe the difference between this modem and another Arris DOCSIS 3.0 modem I have... It is night and day! My ISP has 150/15, and I'm constantly getting 200/30 without batting an eyelash! I wish it had a battery like the Arris it replaced, but I'll take the speed any time, as I can always get a UPS to power during power outages. It's been installed since I received it, and have only restarted it once, when I changed routers. Other than that, this little runt is online 24/7/365 and not caring about much!
customer_reviews.author: Elisamuel Resto

customer_reviews.title: ARRIS SB6190 Junk! Do not buy! Modem return for refund.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is to dislike about this modem.Has latency issues.My download and upload speed dropped dramatically,will not work with internet switches i try different brands.Getting drop connections on all my devices and movie channels. I called spectrum and all most a hour on the phone and talk to different reps the said it was my modem.I went out and buy a NETGEAR C7000v2 and everything works perfect now. ARRIS needs to take this modem off the market.
customer_reviews.author: Twinkie

customer_reviews.title: Your mileage may vary
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup (just connect cable and ethernet, then call cable company to have the MAC address updated, done). Update 3/17 I was having issues with service dropping randomly for random lengths of time. I know cabling or distance was not an issue as the same line was used for business class service with a carrier (TWC/Spectrum) supplied modem with no issues for a little over a year. After a few back and forths with support and numerous "adjusting levels" and disconnect/reconnect, I purchased the Arris BDA-42-1-AR-R and problems went away. Make and model was on carriers supported list of devices. Not having access to diagnostic tools and issues with the carrier is why I removed 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: padlam

customer_reviews.title: This Arris has a faulty chipset that is giving us major latency issues. The company needs to take care of this immediately.
customer_reviews.text: As many others have stated, there is a problem with the Intel chipset causing major latency issues. Im staring a at "Can't play video" at the moment, streaming has been dropping like crazy, and my work is suffering as the frustration is mounting trying to get anything done online where I make my living. I'm hoping Arris Replies to this message, otherwise I will be buying something else and joining the class action suit against them as well as sharing my experience with everyone I can on social media. it seems to be the only way some corporations will back up their products. Comeone Arris, replace the modem with something that doesnt have the issues.
customer_reviews.author: crustomer#1

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: This model worked fine for a while and then stopped working. By this point I could no longer return it. Comcast said they saw no issues on their end and to talk to Arris. Arris told me to talk to Comcast. The warranty return process with Arris was pretty confusing so I gave up since it wasn't worth the required effort. I have an older Arris Surfboard modem that this new model was intended to replace...interestingly that old modem is back in service with no issues. Not sure what happened here, but pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: I replaced the factory faulty SB8200 model with this one.
customer_reviews.text: The SB8200 was a piece of crap. Cable co said they agreed. said the one they had no trouble with was the SB6190. The gig speed tests came in at 780mbps to 850mbps. Perfect. Wifi is the same. the SB8200 varried between 78mbps and 350mbps on 12 consecutive tests. I am happy with the change. I am not happy that I missed the one month return for the piece of crap. don't make the same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C. Dayton

customer_reviews.title: arrisrouter
customer_reviews.text: service 200kbs Reception 1floordown, 25 ft, 5ghz, 180kbs. I bought this to free myself fromrental of modem. This modem works really well and for sure is compatable with comcast. This particular model supports VOIP voice. If you have comcast voice you must buy a voice compatable unit weather you use your land line or not. I tried to get rid of voice but found out due to Triple Play that it will cost more to dump the voice.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Muth

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This modem is an Amazon rated top choice, but underperforms and underwhelms. There is a known issue with the chipset of this modem that has yet to be fixed by a firmware update. There are numerous negative reviews of this modem's issues already written so I won't waste time reiterating the issues, but if you are considering buying this modem, consider other options. Amazon.. your suggestion of this product as a top choice is suspect to me - considering there are known issues with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Granular

customer_reviews.title: No issues, just keeps working. Does run hot by design so be careful where it is placed.
customer_reviews.text: It is on the recommended list for WOW, so as I wanted to get my 500Mbps speed I bought it. So far it is just as rock solid as it’s predecessor that I had running for 5 years with no issues. Be aware that this unit runs hot, so keep it somewhere ventilated, or add forced cooling like I did. I use some of my many AC Infinity usb powered fans to keep air flow over it and a few other things and this really helps keep the temperature down - cool electronics are happier electronics!
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly and was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: My cable company recommends this as one of the options. I had owned/rented Arris products before so knew the quality was good. It was as simple as calling my cable company with the serial number and other information found on the sticker on the bottom and plugging it in. 10 minutes tops as we were good to go! The signal is strong throughout the house. I had a WiFi repeater on the older slower service to boost the signal but it isn't needed now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no more rental fees
customer_reviews.text: Love this modem. Very easy set up with my ISP, RCN. Quick call to them providing the MAC address of the unit and I was up and running. No more $6 a month to rent an old modem that probably cost the cable company $20 new. This has much more speed potential than I pay for (155Mbps), but nice to know it can handle upgrades if I so choose.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip belusko

customer_reviews.title: ARRIS knows this is defective out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Modem uses an Intel Puma 6 chipset which is known to be defective. Problems include: latency, reboots, and failure to maintain sync. Web search "Intel Puma 6 firmware" and you will find that Arris and Intel have been trying to fix the problem for almost a year. Beware this applies to ANY modem with the Intel Puma 6 chipset. Steer clear of them.
customer_reviews.author: h0tw1r3

customer_reviews.title: A cable modem that can handle gaming and streaming for under $100...
customer_reviews.text: We initially blamed the cable company for the slowing streaming once we moved from cable to internet based tv...We had the low end model for the past 5 years before streaming and everyone's iphone linked up. After figuring out we had the old basic model, we moved up to this one and what a difference. No problem with streaming two tvs, even on live events......well worth the money. Simple hookup. The hardest part was getting it set up on the phone with Comcast...
customer_reviews.author: Steve Austin

customer_reviews.title: Class Action Lawsuit in process over poor performance and slowness
customer_reviews.text: What a dog! Actually slower than the 6 year old unit it replaced. Cox recommended a new modem, specifically this one. I had to buy a competing brand (Motorola MB 8600). When I took it to Cox for registration, it was clear I was one of many who had to do the same thing. Woof
customer_reviews.author: Makwa4j

customer_reviews.title: Have only owned this modem for 6 months, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only owned this modem for 6 months, and it has already quit working. No issues for six months and now, nothing, just magically quit working one evening. Will not pick up a signal. Comcast says it's the modem as their test signal is going through with no issues. Naturally this happens while I'm out town, and my wife has to try and deal with this and a bunch of other household things as well. Thanks for making a product that is not reliable and only lasts a few months before dying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with 300 Mbps broadband
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier ARRIS SURFboard model that was great when my broadband speed was 200 Mbps down. When I upgraded Internet speed to 300 Mbps the older model would get only a little over 200 Mbps. The upgrade solved the problem and does a great job handling the higher speed. Problem solved. This is a very good modem -- very stable and simple to set up. I'm very happy with the purchase. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Slow speeds , faulty chip, throttling.
customer_reviews.text: So lately I've been having crazy speed fluctuations. I was wondering what the F was going on (was it comcast?) some days I would test 100mbits down other days i would get 30. One day I got 15.. it just seemed all over the place. I thought maybe comcast was doing maintenance but if im paying for 250 I should at least get 150+ right. Anyways I was looking to make sure all my firmwares were up to date when I stumbled upon some reviews in here about the faulty chip. It all makes sense now. This modem has been messing everything up. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - puma 6 chipset
customer_reviews.text: This product is very poor. I pay for 150mb internet speed and purchased this in Hope's of a faster speed than the cable rental. So far the product has been poor. I will go from 120mb to 20mb and need to restart the thing multiple times a week to have any type of speed.
customer_reviews.author: J orlando

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this modem, especially if you use VPNs
customer_reviews.text: This modem has been a headache since I upgraded from my SB6121 which had no problems. Whenever I want to use my VPN connections when working from home (2-3 days a week), I have to reboot the modem a few times throughout the day just to keep a decent connection, otherwise it gets ridiculously slow. High latency and packet loss. It seems Arris has at least acknowledged the issue and there is a firmware update out there somewhere, but it hasn't fixed it for everyone. Would love to at least try it out, but I am on Charter/Spectrum and still stuck on 9.1.93N. 1 star until fixed I suppose
customer_reviews.author: negativezero

customer_reviews.title: It became rather annoying and so I ended up buying this to replace ...
customer_reviews.text: This fixed all of my internet problems with my ISP. My internet speeds were averaging between 5 - 10 MBPs download and < 1 MBPs upload. Got this guy and I'm seeing a consistent 45 down and 5 up. This is what I pay for, so is what I expect to be getting. My last modem would lose the internet connection once every 45 minutes. It became rather annoying and so I ended up buying this to replace it. Doesn't run hot like some people have said. I do plan to upgrade my internet to a much faster connection in the future, but for now there isn't much need.
customer_reviews.author: Zadees

customer_reviews.title: reliable, fast cable connection
customer_reviews.text: Has a useful web interface for diagnostics. Having enough channels is what's important for higher bit rate connections. Check your ISP for certified/ approved models (Docsis 3.0 may not be enough, by itself). Maybe they are all like this, but I think it takes a long time to come up (about 2 minutes) from cable connection. I got about 200M on a 250M service, using speedtest.
customer_reviews.author: O. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: So I wasted $100. They should put a notification on this ...
customer_reviews.text: This modem has just been plagued with problems when using Comcast/Xfinity. I have Highest internet package available in our area (400m down) and it will occasionally hit that but then lose connection again. I have been battling this since I installed it about 6 months ago. Have had two technicians out to the house and no success. After reading several review with customers who have had similar issues with not getting to power settings in to acceptable ranges I have elected to purchase a different model. So I wasted $100. They should put a notification on this that it may not wotk with Comcast service.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with charter spectrum in montana
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work on charter spectrum. I tried 2 of these modems. The first one worked for twelve hours. The second one, for five days. Well I contacted charter, and had a tech come out to the house. They said there was nothing they could do regarding this modem not working. They also mentioned something about charter locking out these modems, so they would not function on their network. And it's true, modems work great, but charter in Montana, doesn't allow some modems purchased online to operate on their system. A lawsuit was already filed because of this reason before. Seems like they'd learn their lesson. Nope
customer_reviews.author: monkey1509

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be better to pay up front for a good cable modem
customer_reviews.text: Went from Frontier to Comcast as my internet provider. Thought it would be better to pay up front for a good cable modem, instead of being charged the $8-10.00 per month rental fee that they add to your bill monthly. Works for me like a Champ. Since this device is the first thing that connects off the wall, it is the input to the router provided by the ISP. Very simple for me to hook up. Really going to save me a lot of money over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Kimby

customer_reviews.title: Fast And Happily Forgettable
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast, easy to adminster, and no pains modem. We installed it and to be honest haven’t had a single issue or problem since. It handles disconnects (cut external wire 3 times thanks to construction in neighborhood) and can hits some breakneck speeds (yay fast Spectrum). If your looking for a high maintenance modem then this is not for you. If you’re looking for a quick install, fast, and forget about it modem then this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Sean W

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Remember the CAT 6 CABLE!
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade since Comcast is speeding up everyone, and didn't realize I was stuck at just 100 mbs, even though they were giving me over 150-200. so after installing this modem which BTW is easily done, all you do is log on to a laptop that's hardwired to the modem or your computer and Comcast will automatically set up up with a page to add this new modem to your acct. I found out my wife was now getting around 177mbs, but me ATM I am still stuck at 100 till I run new CAT 6 cable to my pute, then I will be good.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I got this when the modem supplied by Spectrum refused to play nice with my router. After a fairly painless support call to Spectrum, during which I had to supply them with this device’s info, I was immediately connected, and the modem also worked just fine with my router. I’m getting in excess of 100mbps now with this modem and Spectrum, and its all been flawless so far. Very glad my friend the IT got suggested this device.
customer_reviews.author: WilburPost

customer_reviews.title: Smoke and Mirrors
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but issues since purchasing this modem. We pay for 100m internet and actually get 60-80, usually. I thought this modem would bring it closer to quoted speeds. Seeing about 15-20 on 5G with the Arris. I have to constantly reset the device because the internet will just drop all connections at random times. My wife works from home and her IT Dept said there are major issues with the chip used in these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Brian with a Y.

customer_reviews.title: First Class Modem
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the negative reviews, this is a excellent modem. I've had mine installed for over a month with absolutely no issues. It replaced a 6120 that was still working after 6 years but was running into congestion problems in our neighborhood. I took it out of the box, hooked it up, and spent 5 minutes on the phone with Cox tech support to register the Modem's MAC Address. Been working perfectly ever since. I stream movies, play games, and pass large files. All at peak performance. Some reviewers complain about gaming performance but mine is faultless. I don't expect my hardware to compensate for poorly programmed games.
customer_reviews.author: John Grove

customer_reviews.title: SB6190 has performance issues.  *Not Recommended* until Intel and Arris implement a firmware fix (ETA Unknown)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this modem... But it has some issues with it's current firmware. For an average user, you'll be amazed at the throughput. However, gamers are not going to be pleased when it occasionally freezes during a game. As others have stated, you can google for "DSLReports Puma6" to find out details. I've returned the SB6190, and replaced it with the. I'm including a screenshot of the SB6190 jitter test, which shows abysmal jitter performance. Intel and Arris are currently working on a solution to this issue, but until it is fixed I'll have to give this modem a "Do Not Buy" rating.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mccleary

customer_reviews.title: terrific modem
customer_reviews.text: This modem is great. We were having connection problems after increasing our speed. The internet would drop intermittently and our cable company could never figure out what the problem was. After doing some research, I found that higher internet speed had more channels than lower speed. I realized our router was almost 8 years old and checked the specs. It only had about 1/2 the needed channels. I bought this and bam! No drops and our speed is rock solid, not one drop since getting it. You would think that the first thing the internet company would do would be to verify that your modem will work with a speed upgrade. The browser interface is easy to use too.
customer_reviews.author: DoninWV

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for about two months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem as an upgrade from a SB6141. It worked great for about two months, then it started slowing down to 10% of my speed. I use two modems so I could confirm that it was the modem and not my ISP. The manufacturer was of no help in resolving this defective modem and unfortunately the time to get a refund has passed. Arris' customer support and defective product has cost them this customer.
customer_reviews.author: Bullphrog

customer_reviews.title: This model was a great upgrade from the Mediacom supplied standard modem
customer_reviews.text: This model was a great upgrade from the Mediacom supplied standard modem. After less than 30-minutes of powering up and calling Mediacom to activate the model, I checked my download speed and it was even faster than before. I got a great deal on a 'used' model, and was able to register this with Arris and found that I still have over 1-year left on the warranty. Definitely would recommend as a way to eliminate the monthly rental fees (it will pay for itself in less than 7 months).
customer_reviews.author: RussiaDad

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Grande Communications
customer_reviews.text: we have 300mbps internet from Grande Communications in Temple TX. This modem works perfectly with grande and our actual internet speeds at anywhere from 280mbps to 350mbps. This modem will support much faster speeds. With Grande only 24 of the 32 downstream channels bonded and 4 of the 8 upstream channels bonded. I didnt expect Grande would utilize all 32x8 channels. I just wanted a modem that would be ready if we upped our speeds in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonoholic

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Cox San Diego
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting 383 down / 36 up with this modem on the Cox Ultimate package in San Diego. Locked on to 24 downstream and 4 upstream channels. Note that after Cox provisioned this and I first plugged it in, I was only getting 125 down (which was my previous speed), but a few minutes later, the modem rebooted itself and then locked onto 24 downstream channels and started getting 383 down. It does use a different power adapter than my previous SB6141. Overall, great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This router increased my internet speeds from 15mbps to 200 mbps. Unreal. I do not have cable...just streaming services which rely heavily on fast, consistent internet speeds. I'm 68 years old and I hooked it up myself. Easy peasy. It truly has changed my life. No more getting kicked out in the middle of a tv show due to slow speeds. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra F

customer_reviews.title: Does not play well with Xfinity - returned
customer_reviews.text: Does not play well with Xfinity - returned More latency than the Post Office. My old Motorola modem is not designed to deliver the speeds possible with Docsis 3. But its responsiveness makes it a pleasure to use. Went back to it. Suggest making latency more of a criteria. Speed is of no use if you're sitting there staring at an unresponsive display.
customer_reviews.author: RaytoTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Charter
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with Charter as of this date despite being on their online list. Confirmed after 3 hours with technician at my home. Worked initially for a few hours but apparently automatic firmware update overnight created conflict per tech. Had to have tech give me a Charter modem.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel VW

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to set up and didn't work, at least with Comcast.  Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work and had to return. I bought one of these for my house and it setup easy. However I bought another for my parents. I spent so much time setting it up and it wouldn't work. It might be Comcast but I followed the directions on the guide regarding Comcast and it didn't work. So I was forced to return it. Very frustrating spending all that time and effort. Do not recommend it, at least for Comcast. My own worked fine for my house with a different provider. I'll write a positive review on that one.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Modem...
customer_reviews.text: Installation was simply and basically plug-in-play. The modem works perfectly with Xfinity high speeds. I did have to call Comcast to activate the modem with their service but have had nothing but a positive experience ever since. I highly recommend this modem to others.
customer_reviews.author: UnitedAsOne

customer_reviews.title: Bump up you speed with this beast! Make sure your provider supports up to 32 channels!
customer_reviews.text: Bumped up my speeds with this! Most cable modems are 8 or 16 channels only. when those channels get crowded you will see speeds drop. No cable company really cares about the speed you get, so they set you up with the low end 8 channel model like everyone else, then you get bogged down. I refuse to have my Porn buffer, so make sure your cable company supports up to 32 channels ( I have Cox Cable and they do) and you will see a immediate speed boost because very few people have the modems that use the other 16-24 channels that are really available.
customer_reviews.author: Loren S. Young

customer_reviews.title: Product failed
customer_reviews.text: Product failed less than 2 months after purchase. I added insurance with Amazon and they denied the claim. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: A+ Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem
customer_reviews.text: I have always had very good service from the SurfBoard brand modems. I wasn't aware of the name change from Arris to Motorola however. The modem works great and the speed is excellent with my provider Suddenlink. I would recommend this modem to anyone needing speeds up to a gigabyte per second. My last SurfBoard modem has lasted me over 5 years and worked great, but needed a 32 channel modem instead. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible with Optimum Internet
customer_reviews.text: This definitively does not work with Optimum internet even though multiple places insists that it will. It will not. Have not had any problem with other Arris products. I'm sure this one is fine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sane Person

customer_reviews.title: Defective do not buy, bad chip
customer_reviews.text: This item is defective. It has a bad Puma 6 chip. This modem is full of problems with latency.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence1

customer_reviews.title: Bad Puma Chipset
customer_reviews.text: Used for a number of years and seemed okay. Then it began cutting-out and in. Internet speeds varied so much it was causing lag time, and buffering. Replaced with Motorola MB8600 DOCSIS 3.1/ 3.0 32X8 Cable Modem and the Netgear R7000 modem. Speeds steady at 180 mbps and paying for 150 Had also read somewhere about a class action suite because of the Puma Chipset's failure
customer_reviews.author: JakeDog

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older SURFboard modem that only had 8x4 channels. My ISP doesn't use all the upstream channels yet, but so far everything else seems to be working very well on my 75MBs service. It's much cheaper than paying the rental to the cable company, even if you replace it every few years. They make these with and without integrated wifi/router features, but I much prefer the modem-only models. Wifi tech and network security features advance at a much faster rate than cable modem tech, so I'd rather keep them on separate upgrade cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cassella

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned less than two months after warranty expired.
customer_reviews.text: This modem worked great for a little over two years before I started experiencing slow speeds. After eventually contacting Arris, I spent over an hour on a live chat with them before they told me the device was malfunctioning and I had to call in to verify the warranty. I spent another fifteen minutes on the phone with their tech support only to learn the warranty had expired two months earlier. TLDR: The product works great until it doesn't. Maybe I just got unlucky but if you buy one of these, don't be surprised if it goes bad immediately after the warranty expires.
customer_reviews.author: David Streng

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: This product worked fine for a while, but recently has been having significant issues. This modem has a problem where it will stop allowing the internet signal in. When calling comcast, there is no issue on their side. When calling Arris, there is a known problem with their modems...something about a puma chip?!? Unfortunately I have no resolution at this time and no internet. The product was bought for its speed that it was suppose to have, yet I have nothing for internet at my home. A google search has shown that I am not the only one with a defective modem. It's a shame that it took six months to see this defect.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Craton

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Comcast Cable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a college apartment to connect to Comcast cable. It worked and connected flawlessly after the cable tech found a signal splitter that had too many connections on it impacting signal strength to the apartment. Comcast had no problem with their on-site technician with this cable modem as it's currently certified compatible with their network. As for the Linksys wireless router, that took some time to figure out how to connect to the unit and get it programmed. Typical Linksys, but that's a different story. Would I buy this ARRIS unit again? Yes, for use with Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: road_warrior

customer_reviews.title: Return your leased modem and get this already!
customer_reviews.text: As of this review, this is the best DOCSIS 3 modem out due to the lack of availability of 32/8 channel modems. I paid $122 at the time and though its cheaper today still a great value for those looking for the fastest possible cable modem. Setup was straightforward and registration easy through Comcast. I have the 100Mbps service and getting 170Mbps consistently. its currently paired with Netgear's Orbi mesh WiFi AP and its nothing short of awesome.
customer_reviews.author: jpotegal

customer_reviews.title: Best Cable Modem you can buy..  Why lease when you can own your own.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on the recommendation of my cable guy. Why pay to lease a cable modem when you can own your own? It pays for itself in less than a year and works with any (that I'm aware of) internet service provider. Motorola sold off Arris but the product quality is stellar. Had it running solid for several months now with NO down time or reboots from cable provider. Supports speeds up to 1GB.
customer_reviews.author: Tamazon

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how they are still selling this modem. I thought I had unreliable internet service. After researching the problem, I found the discussions about the Puma chipset. Replaced this modem, and all is well. I can't believe I dealt with the problem for 2 plus years. I am looking forward to my refund due to the class action lawsuit.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this modem for a few months now and haven't had any issues what so ever. I downsized and got rid of cable and wanted a new modem and router so I could save a bit more money on my monthly bill. After a lot of research I decided on this model. I paired it with a Google Wifi device. It has kept up with all of my needs. I stream Neflix, Amazon Prime and Sling without hickups or lagging. I have since recommeded this brand and setup to a few friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: iCre8art

customer_reviews.title: Defective Intel PUMA 6 processor, AMAZON PULL THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.text: Defective Intel PUMA 6 processor, massive lawsuit against arris for still selling it. Kept thinking there was issues with my cable line, network and replaced the modem multiple times. Come to find out it is defective CPU that cannot just be fixed with a software update, the cpu is bad and the fix is the "Puma 7" processor.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased this so long ago...
customer_reviews.text: My Comcast modem constantly slowed to a crawl. Plus I'd been paying the same monthly rental fee for way more years than it was worth. I got this, hooked it up the second* night I had it and haven't had a problem since. *in order to configure this modem, you have to plug a computer directly into it using a CAT-whatever network cable. I ran into a slight problem with this when I realized that none of the 3 laptops in my household had network adaptors anymore. The iPad was no help either. I had to borrow a USB to network cable adaptor from work to get it going.
customer_reviews.author: TRC

customer_reviews.title: This modem is crap. I replaced a 6183 with this modem
customer_reviews.text: While this modem works, if you plan on using it for games or for internet video (multiple streams,) get something without the Intel PUMA 6 chipset. This modem is crap. I replaced a 6183 with this modem, figuring it was faster since it had more channels. Boy was I wrong. Games started lagging and watching more than one video stream would result in studdering. SlingTV would fail to load and play video, and Netflix would have periodic problems watching videos. Went back to the 6183, and all these issues went away. Sure, you get good speeds, but with all the re-transmits and failures handling many TCP/UDP packets at once, it is far more trouble than its worth getting the speed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mattison

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Comcast broadband
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for setting up my Comcast broadband...no problem since installing 9 months ago
customer_reviews.author: Dmont1

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: Bought my own modem rather than pay rent from Comcast/Xfinity. This is ethernet only so there's no wifi in this--if you want wifi you'll need a separate router. IMPORTANT NOTE: watch any refurbs or used modems. Those may not have been properly cleared by the original owners' cable provider when the acc't was closed. If the previous owner had their acc't shut off possibly due to unpaid bills, the modem's MAC address is still on file tied to that acc't. It could take some time to show you aren't that person. This is why I decided to buy this NEW rather than the refurbs at half the price. For the 60 Mbps service we had, I never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McDonald

customer_reviews.title: I own a previous version of this SURFboard and LOVE IT. However
customer_reviews.text: I own a previous version of this SURFboard and LOVE IT. However, This unit won't connect. I even sent another one back thinking the unit must be Damaged somehow. So I purchased another and called ARRIS and their Customer Service was great! They talked me through the setup process for almost 45 minutes, it would not connect. So I called Time Warner (Spectrum) and paid a service fee. They came out and tried for over an hour to get the unit to connect. They tested my line and signal and found - according to them - no problems. So I'm sending this one back also.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn R

customer_reviews.title: arris flop
customer_reviews.text: purchased an arris modem sb6190 as a part of a complete replacement of a private network. The arris modem had a constant problem with loss of connection needing a complete re-initialization and no capacity to maintain a VPN connection. This was a point of contention for almost a year. Then we tried a motorola modem, mb7621. the problems are much reduced and the VPN will now stay connected for more than 3 seconds. the modem change is the only change that has been made to the system. if you use VPN, get a different modem.
customer_reviews.author: skeeve

customer_reviews.title: Works great on COX cable
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched from DSL to Cable. Since I already had a decent router, I bought this modem that was listed as compatible with COX cable. As soon as my cable internet was ready I plugged in the modem hooked it to the cable feed and hooked the ethernet cable to the router. After authorizing the modem for my account everything came to life with no isues. Works as expected, but I do agree with others who have pointed out that the Blue LEDs are quite bright, I guess Arris could 'feature' this as a modem/night light.
customer_reviews.author: CA Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Puma chip is terrible. There is a puma6 test on dslreports
customer_reviews.text: Puma chip is terrible. There is a puma6 test on dslreports...this modem is so terrible that it can be identified by a simple test that everything else on the market passes. Say normal ping is 30ms....every 10th ping with this will be something like 200-300ms. If you are familiar with tcp...you know why that's bad. My recommendations: Go with the 8200 or the 6183.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron
